plugins.name: MGS Composer - Exporter
plugins.description:
Export your Figma Design into a Microchip Graphics Composer Project

Streamline your design workflow with the MGS Composer Exporter. This plugin bridges the gap between Figma's design environment and MGS Composer, enabling you to create stunning user interfaces in Figma and transfer them to Composer for further development.


Features

Automatic Asset Generation: Composer generates assets automatically from the exported data, saving time and effort.

Preserved Design Hierarchy: Composer mirrors Figma's design tree as closely as possible, ensuring an accurate translation of your design.

Component Support: Assets generated from Figma Components are treated as a shared resource, saving memory on your target device.


Detailed Guide


How to Use:

  1. Install the Plugin: Add it to your Figma workspace.
  2. Run the Plugin: An export window will appear on the right side of Figma's interface.
  3. Select Page: Navigate to the page you want to export from and click Select Page.
  4. Mark Objects for Export: The export window will list top-level objects. These will be translated to Screens in Composer. Select objects by clicking on them or their children in the Figma design, which will automatically mark them in the export window.
  5. Set Export Options: After selecting objects, choose from two options:
  6. Flatten Group Components during export: Flattens groups into a single image in the exported data.
  7. Export all primitives as .svg assets: Exports vectors like rectangles, lines, and text as SVG assets.
  8. Generate Data: Click the Generate Data button. The export window will show a view of all exported objects and a corresponding JSON file. You can add custom properties to the objects here in the upper view.
  9. Export File: Click the Export button at the bottom of the window and select a location to save the file.
  10. Open MGS Composer: Launch Composer and create a new design or open an existing one with a screen size adequate for your Figma content.
  11. Import Project: In Composer, go to "File > Import" and select Figma Composer Project. Confirm the prompt that appears.
  12. Done: Composer will import the file and add new screens, assets, and widgets to your design.


Support & Feedback:

MGS User Guide

MGS Forum
plugins.tagline: Exports your Figma Design into a Microchip Graphics Composer Project.

plugins.name: BulkGen
plugins.description:
BulkGen figma plugin saves you hundreds of hours of doing grunt work. If you're tasked with creating the same design, lots of time with just some data changing â€” don't wast time doing it manually. Just use bulkgen, it can auto populate your figma designs from a Google Sheet.


Features:

  1. Google Sheet Import: Make sure these are set to public.
  2. CSV Import: Works for local files


How it Works:

  1. Paste your Google Sheets URL
  2. Make sure the dynamic layers in Figma are labelled correctly (ex: firstname would be #firstname)
  3. Select a base template and hit generate, it's that easy.


Use Cases:

  1. Event Banners: Doing the same event in many cities? This will work for that
  2. Certificates: Automate 1000s of certificates in just a few clicks
  3. Wedding Invites: Mail Merge is so oldschool, just use this.
  4. And Many More.


Website: https://bulkgen.app

Help docs: https://ybnco.notion.site/BulkGen-Help-Docs-1905dc1b35f980f0becbe647dfae68d4

Email me: yb@yashbhardwaj.com
plugins.tagline: Generate Figma Designs From Google Sheets/CSV

plugins.name: Adapture by INKR
plugins.description:
Adapture makes it easy to adapt your designs for new marketsâ€”right inside Figma. By understanding your content and layout, it rewrites and translates text that fits seamlessly into your design and speaks to your audience.


No broken layouts, no manual fixesâ€”just content that works.


Why Designers Love Adapture:


  1. Effortless Adaptation: Select your frames, set your goals, and let Adapture handle the rest. It rewrites and translates text while keeping your layout intact.
  2. Smarter Translations: Adapture analyzes your design and messaging to deliver text that matches the tone, intent, and purpose of your work.
  3. Consistent Messaging: Whether youâ€™re creating for new audiences or adapting for different markets, Adapture helps you keep your messaging aligned and on-brand.
  4. Saves Time: Automates the heavy lifting so you can focus on creating, not fixing.


Key Features:


  1. Design-Aware Adaptation: Adapture understands your designs and rewrites text to fit your layout, intent, and audience.
  2. Cultural Customization: Adapt for new markets with sensitivity to language, tone, and local nuances.
  3. Built for Designers: Works right inside Figma, so you can adapt and update designs without disrupting your workflow.
  4. Seamless Integration: Keeps your layouts clean and intact, saving you time and effort.


Perfect For:


  1. Designers creating multilingual or culturally tailored content.
  2. Teams expanding into new markets or working across global audiences.
  3. Anyone who wants to streamline design adaptation without sacrificing quality.


----

Currently in Closed Beta


Adapture is available in closed beta. You can request an invitation code directly from the plugin to start adapting your designs today.
plugins.tagline: Make Your Designs Work for Any Audience

plugins.name: Voice to Text for Figma
plugins.description:
Easily insert text into Figma using your voice!

Click â€œOpen Voice Toolâ€ â†’ Start speaking in the browser â†’ Your speech will be transcribed and automagically added into your selected Figma text layer.

No typing. Just talking.


âœ… Use Case 1:

â€œTired of switching between docs and Figma just to copy-paste written content?â€

Speak directly into the pluginâ€™s voice tool and instantly push the transcription into your selected text boxâ€”no tab switching, no distractions.


âœ… Use Case 2:

â€œWant to insert longer text into your Figma design without typing it all out?â€

Use Voice to Text for Figma to dictate your content and have it transcribed directly into your designâ€”perfect for mockups, user flows, or note-taking during brainstorming.


Supported Features & Limits:

âœ… Languages Supported: English, Arabic, Chinese (Simplified), Dutch, French, German, Hindi, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish

ğŸ• Time Limit: Records up to 60 seconds per session, auto-warns you before timeout

ğŸŒ Browser Compatibility:

âœ… Supported: Google Chrome, Safari, Opera, Samsung Internet

âš ï¸ Partially Supported: Microsoft Edge, Firefox

âŒ Not Supported: Internet Explorer, Brave, Arc

ğŸ§  Auto-restart: On silence to ensure smoother capture

ğŸ™ Microphone Permission : Detects and guidance for Mac & Windows users.

ğŸ–¥ï¸ Figma Compatibility: Works seamlessly on both Figma Browser and Figma Desktop / Mac App

âœ… Accessibility Enhancements

â¤ï¸ Open Source Code: https://github.com/mryeshwanth/voice-figma-plugin


How it works:

  1. When you click Open Voice Tool, a new browser window will open to start recording.
  2. This is required because Figma Mac/Desktop plugins canâ€™t access your microphone directly.
  3. The tool uses your browser's built-in Web Speech API (SpeechRecognition) to transcribe your voice locally â€” nothing is sent to any external server.
  4. Once done, the transcription is securely sent back to the Figma plugin and inserted into your selected text node.
plugins.tagline: Convert your voice to text, directly into Figma.

plugins.name: Smart Rename
plugins.description:
Smart Rename is a powerful Figma plugin built to streamline your workflow by letting you bulk rename frames customizable base names and smart suffixes like version numbers, dimensions, or sequence numbers.


It also fixes a common frustration in UI design: decimal positioning. When frames have non-integer X or Y values, exported assets often end up with unwanted white lines or blurry edges. Smart Rename solves this by auto-aligning frames to the nearest whole pixel, ensuring clean, sharp exports every time.


From organization to export-readiness, this plugin saves time and eliminates manual, error-prone tasksâ€”all in a few clicks.
plugins.tagline: Bulk rename and align Figma frames in seconds. Add version, size, or number suffixes effortlessly.

plugins.name: Tazym
plugins.description:
Introducing Tazym, the ultimate Figma plugin that streamlines the design-to-web process. With Tazym, you can effortlessly upload your designs to the cloud, generating a unique URL that allows you to update your design in Figma in real-time. Say goodbye to manual website updates or the need to rely on developers. With Tazym, you are the creator, and you own your designs.


Getting started with Tazym is easy. Simply select your design, name it, choose a format (SVG, PNG, or JPG), and voila - you have a URL that can be used anywhere to showcase your work. When inspiration strikes and you want to make updates, it's as easy as editing in Figma and hitting the Update button in Tazym. Your users will see your latest creations instantly.


Ready to take control of your designs and streamline your workflow? Visit tazym.com to learn more and start using Tazym today!

  1. One-Click Creation: Select any Figma component to generate an Azure Board item.

  3. Direct Linking: Clickable links between Azure work items and components.
  4. Custom Field Mapping: Match your Azure setup with flexible field configs.
  5. Team Area Support: Organize work in your projectâ€™s structure.
  6. Smart Field Detection: Autofills required Azure fields.


Why Teams Use It

  1. Save timeâ€”no more screenshots or copy-paste.
  2. Developers get full visual context.
  3. Sync design and dev workflows effortlessly.
  4. Keep everything traceable and connected.


How to Get Started

  1. Select a Figma component
  2. Add your Azure Personal Access Token (requires Read & Write access for work items)

  4. Customize the item
  5. Click Create

plugins.name: Consistify
plugins.description:
With the Consistify plugin, you can be be able to:


Detect Design Inconsistencies: Scan multiple frames for discrepancies in font styles, colors, buttons, iconography(coming soon), spacing, and navigation elements(coming soon) etc.


Get Visual Feedback: Receive clear, color-coded tags indicating inconsistencies, with direct frame references and numerical comparisons for easy analysis.


Streamline Workflow(coming soon): Highlight design issues directly in the UI, allowing users to click and focus on problematic frames, helping maintain design system integrity across projects.


To use the Consistify plugin, follow these steps:


Open your design in Figma.

Select at least 2 frames you want to compare for inconsistencies.

Run the Plugin


Advanced Features(coming son:


Accessibility Checker: Analyze contrast ratios in real-time for WCAG compliance.

Component Management: Identify duplicate components and track usage statistics.


Design System Health Monitoring: Flag inconsistent color usage, manual overrides on text styles, and mismatched font sizes.


The plugin is a must-have tool for ensuring cohesive, well-structured designs while saving time on manual checks.

plugins.name: Grid Counter
plugins.description: Grid Counter calculates how many grid columns or rows a selected element spans within its parent frame. To use, simply select an element inside a frame with a layout grid, and the plugin will display the number of columns or rows it spans. It updates in real-time as you select different elements. You can also adjust the grid columns with a click of a button.

plugins.name: EasyMemo
plugins.description:
EasyMemo is a versatile plugin for creating, editing, and managing text memos within Figma. With EasyMemo, you can easily add colorful sticky notes, shapes with text, and simple text nodes to your canvas, helping to keep your workspace organized.


Key Features:


Memo Creation and Editing: Simply enter your text, select your desired memo type, and create memos effortlessly. You can edit memos directly on the canvas, and updates are reflected in real-time.

Customizable Colors: Choose colors from a preset color palette, allowing you to categorize and prioritize memos. The text color automatically adjusts for optimal readability based on the selected background color.

Easy Management:


Organize Memos in a List: Add memos to a list for better organization. You can update or delete memo texts directly from the list. The list is scrollable and always up-to-date.

Batch Generation: Easily generate all listed memos at once. Just click the "Create Shapes" button, and all memos will be neatly arranged on the canvas.

Efficient Layout: Memos are generated in the center of the viewport, focusing on the most relevant areas. They are neatly arranged to avoid overlap.

User-Friendly Interface: The modern and intuitive design features a clearly laid-out text input area, radio buttons for selecting memo types, a color palette, and a dynamically updating list.

How to Use:


Enter Text: Input your memo content in the text input area.

Select Memo Type: Choose from shapes with text, simple text, or sticky notes using the radio buttons.

Pick a Color: Select a color from the palette to categorize your memos. The selected color applies to the memo background, and the text color adjusts automatically.

Add to List: Press the Enter key to add the memo to the list. You can edit or delete memos directly within the list.

Generate Memos: Click the "Create Shapes" button to generate all memos on the canvas at once. Memos are centered in the viewport and neatly arranged.

EasyMemo is the perfect tool for organizing ideas and feedback within your Figma projects. Whether brainstorming, planning, or collaborating, EasyMemo simplifies memo management and supports you efficiently.

plugins.name: strings_repository
plugins.description:
Simple plugin to synchronise translations with strings repository. Allows to push and pull translations from your own server. Works with active selection to speedup parsing processes.


Usage:

Enter connection details and press connect button.

After selection of element press "refresh selection" to get text labels from selection.

Press "pull" to fetch translations from remote server.

Press "apply" to apply translations from selected translations to document selection.

Press "push" to send translations to remote server.
plugins.tagline: Synchronize your translations

plugins.description:
Ripplix â€” friction-free design hand-off with motion

Skip the time-consuming prototypes and pin real-world interactions straight onto your Figma file.

Ripplix already has a curated library of 1 500 + micro-interactions from 300 + live apps & sites into an easy-to-search sidebar. One click drops a comment tag on the exact UI element (button, card, tabâ€¦) and links to a full-screen preview on ripplix.com so developers instantly see how it should feelâ€”timing, easing, choreography and all.


Why youâ€™ll use it every hand-off

  1. Contextual pins â€“ Each animation is attached as a Figma comment on the layer you select, so engineers donâ€™t have to hunt for it.
  2. Real-app reference â€“ Every clip comes from production UIs, giving devs proven motion patterns instead of speculative mocks.
  3. Search that speaks UX â€“ Filter by platform (Web, iOS, Android, Watch), pattern (hover, dropdown, empty stateâ€¦), industry or keyword.
  4. One-click preview â€“ Comment contains a â€œView on Ripplixâ€ link â†’ opens the HD interaction with playback controls, frame counter and downloadable Lottie/CSS snippets.
  5. Zero bloat â€“ Nothing is embedded in the Figma file except a tiny thumbnail + link, so your files stay light.


Typical Workflow

  1. Select a layer that needs motion polish.
  2. In the Ripplix sidebar search â€œhover + dropdownâ€.
  3. Preview candidates; click Add to Figma.
  4. A comment tag appears on your layer, click upon you can preview the motion.
  5. During hand-off, devs open the link, watch the real interaction, and build it confident theyâ€™re matching the reference.


Need help or want to suggest an animation weâ€™re missing?

Install Ripplix â†’ pin a motion reference â†’ ship delightful, on-brand interactionsâ€”without another endless prototype.

plugins.name: Class Action
plugins.description:
Class Action is a powerful CSS-like styling tool that revolutionizes how designers work with consistent design tokens and variables in Figma. Create Tailwind-inspired class libraries, UI kits, and design templates with ease, then apply saved styles instantly to other frames with a single click.


Key features:

  1. Create and manage reusable style classes similar to CSS and Tailwind classes
  2. Build and apply complete UI kits and design templates across multiple frames
  3. Preserve Figma variables, color tokens, and style references in your templates
  4. Full support for Tailwind-like utility classes, component styles, and design tokens
  5. Premium version with unlimited style classes and advanced template management


Class Action brings CSS and Tailwind-inspired workflows to Figma by eliminating repetitive styling tasks. Perfect for design systems, UI kit creation, template libraries, and maintaining visual consistency across projects. Save time, reduce styling errors, and keep your designs perfectly aligned with your component library or Tailwind-like system.


Compatible with both light and dark Figma themes, supports variable tokens for responsive templates, and optimized for performance even in large UI kit files with complex component libraries.
plugins.tagline: Think as a designer, act like a developer.

136903.release_notes:
This update introduces powerful new control features and interface improvements that provide more precise management over how styles are applied to your Figma elements. The plugin now offers granular property selection and enhanced user experience consistency throughout the interface.

New in this release:
â€¢ Selective Property Application System: Choose exactly which properties to apply from saved classes with granular category control (Dimensions, Layout, Appearance, Fills, Strokes, Effects, Variables, Grids, Position)
â€¢ Persistent Property Preferences: Class-specific scope settings are remembered and indicated with visual markers for streamlined workflows
â€¢ Enhanced CSS Property Display: ClassDetails modal now shows only valid CSS properties, filtering out Figma-specific attributes for cleaner code reference
â€¢ Standardized Interface Components: Unified text styling across all modal dialogs for improved visual consistency
â€¢ Updated Promotional Pricing: Summer special offer with 50% discount (â‚¬4.50/year instead of â‚¬9/year) using code Y0NTY0NA
â€¢ Improved Import/Export Compatibility: Enhanced data format support ensures seamless class sharing across different plugin versions

These enhancements provide more control over style application while maintaining the plugin's focus on efficiency and precision. The selective application system addresses user requests for more granular control without compromising the streamlined workflow that makes Class Action effective for rapid Figma design iterations.

You can also convert the Korean number to a Korean number unit or convert the Korean number back to an Arabic number.
